extractions.description: This study investigates the effect of sagittal versus axial scanning on the quality of spinal cord functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (scfMRI) data. Utilizing a Philips Achieva 3T MRI scanner, the research compares metrics such as tSNR, Dice Coefficient, Reproducibility, and Sensitivity between the two scanning planes. The findings suggest that axial scanning is generally more advantageous for mitigating physiological noise and ensuring higher data quality.

type.justification: The study involves systematic data collection and analysis to compare the effectiveness of axial versus sagittal scanning planes for spinal cord fMRI.
type.quote: This study was aimed at systematically verify whether sagittal scanning in scfMRI using EPI readout is a viable alternative to the more common axial scanning, and at optimizing a pipeline for EPI-based scfMRI data analysis, based on Spinal Cord Toolbox (SCT).

research_field.justification: The paper focuses on improving functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging techniques specifically for spinal cord imaging.
research_field.quote: Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI) is based on the Blood Oxygenation Level Dependent contrast and has been exploited for the indirect study of the neuronal activity within both the brain and the spinal cord.

sub_research_field.justification: The focus of the study is on imaging the spinal cord using functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI).
sub_research_field.quote: However, the interpretation of spinal cord fMRI (scfMRI) is still controversial and its diffusion is rather limited because of technical limitations.

name.justification: The SCT was used to perform spatial pre-processing tasks and to normalize EPI images to the PAM50 template.

type.justification: The SCT is a software tool specialized for processing spinal cord MRI data.
type.quote: the Spinal Cord Toolbox (SCT) has been developed 25, and can be used to analyse structural and functional data.

name.justification: The PAM50 template was used for spatial normalization of the spinal cord imaging data.
